com.facebook

Class AccessTokenTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.AccessTokenTracker

  • public abstract class AccessTokenTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be extended to receive notifications of access token changes. The stopTracking() method should be called in the onDestroy() method of the receiving Activity or Fragment.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AccessTokenTracker()
      The constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isTracking()
      Gets whether the tracker is tracking the current access token.
      protected abstract void onCurrentAccessTokenChanged(AccessToken oldAccessToken, AccessToken currentAccessToken)
      The method that will be called with the access token changes.
      void startTracking()
      Starts tracking the current access token
      void stopTracking()
      Stops tracking the current access token.

      • AccessTokenTracker

        public AccessTokenTracker()
        The constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • onCurrentAccessTokenChanged

        protected abstract void onCurrentAccessTokenChanged(AccessToken oldAccessToken,
                               AccessToken currentAccessToken)
        The method that will be called with the access token changes.
        Parameters:
        oldAccessToken - The access token before the change.
        currentAccessToken - The new access token.

      • startTracking

        public void startTracking()
        Starts tracking the current access token

      • stopTracking

        public void stopTracking()
        Stops tracking the current access token.

      • isTracking

        public boolean isTracking()
        Gets whether the tracker is tracking the current access token.
        Returns:
        true if the tracker is tracking the current access token, false if not
